lines.text: Mahoney! Remember, that nobody screws with me.
Well, maybe you'll meet the right girl and all that will change.
Drop that stereo before I blow your goddamn nuts off, asshole.
I was a florist.
A florist?
Yeah, you know, flowers and shit.
To me, marriage is a sacred institution. So tell me, you and the wife do it doggie-style, or what?
Son, where did you get that gun?

[smiling proudly]
My mum gave it to me.

[after Hightower has been thrown out of the Academy]
Of all the guys who I thought were gonna make it, Hightower was the one. I mean, if all the cops looked like him there'd be no crime at all.
What's wrong with this man?
There was gunplay, sir, and he missed it.

[On their way to a riot zone]
We are being sent to a safe area away from the disturbance. Our job will be to divert traffic away from the trouble zone, and to protect public property. You will have live ammunition, but there will be no call to use it - TACKLEBERRY! Do you understand, numbnuts?

[having had his head recently removed from a horse's behind]
You told, no one?
Not a soul.

[Harris passes in front of the line of cadets, and is annoyed to see that they are all straining not to laugh at him. He becomes even more annoyed when he notices that Sgt. Callahan is also on the verge of bursting out laughing. When he passes near Jones, Jones makes sound of horse neigh, as if to make it clear that everyone heard about the embarrassing incident]
our main building. On slide... TWO! We see other view... of... IT! Oh, my God, you wouldn't believe it!

[Hightower smashes into the bumper of another car]
You didn't hit the brakes.
You didn't tell me to.
"Hey, dirtbags!" that means you. You people are going to hate my guts for the rest of your lives. I am going to make you sorry that you ever came here.

[a thug, after being knocked down some stairs, realizes he's still got a gun in his waist. He reaches for it, and a revolver is pointed in his face]
*Don't move, dirtbag!*
You make me sick.
Thank you, sir. I make everybody sick.
Hey! Why didn't you guys call me this weekend?
Well, nothing really happened, sir.
There was a party, wasn't there?
Yes, sir.
Well, what went on?
Dancing, sir. Mostly dancing.

[to himself]
Dancing?
Sir. Look, sir, new pants.

[notices that Mahoney is holding the megaphone]
What are you doing with that? Give me that.
[Harris grabs his megaphone from Mahoney and uses it, without noticing that Mahoney applied brown shoe polish on it]
All right, you scumballs. You have a 30 minutes to hit the showers and get to class. Let's go! Move it! Move it! Move it! Pick it up! Pick it up! Pick it up, assholes!
[Harris then turns to Cmdt. Lassard, with shoe polish from his megaphone all around his lips, looking like a goatee]
So far, nobody's quit, but they will.
[Cmdt. Lassard laughs at Harris. Harris, thinking that perhaps he said something funny, joins his laughter]
Then, Mahoney, my little pissant... you are out of the Academy forever. Get your stuff, and get out. Too bad, so sad, bye-bye.

[Mahoney and Blankes are in Lt.Harris' office due to Barbara throwing the first punch at Copeland via lunch tray. Harris is cleaning his stick]
Who threw the first punch? That's all I want to know.

[before Mahoney can answer]
Barbara did.
Barbara?
That's right.
Then he's out of here. Him and his queer dog.
[Mahoney and Thompson, both in full dress uniform, are kissing passionately before the graduation ceremony]
You men stop that!
[Thompson turns around, removes her cap and smiles, showing her face and long hair to Lassard]
Oh... OHHH! Well. That's more like it, Mahoney. Good man. Keep up the good work!
Yes, sir!
Thompson, Why you do want to be a cop?
I like to dress as a man
Me too

[In the TV Version edited with no swearing]
What is it? What is it?
She ran over my feet!
Oh, I'm sorry. I really am.
Sorry? You dumb, fat nincompoop!
Sleeping is for fags.
You move this car another inch and you're finished, mister. You hear me?
Now, I thought it would be nice if we were to close out our first afternoon together with a nice little stroll around the campus.
[shouts]
Move out, maggots!
Boy, there sure are a lot of spades around here.
[sees Hightower standing next to him]

[in a choked voice]
Which I think is good. Very good for the Academy.

[Blankes smears potato salad on Mahoney's shirt]
Your move... Ma-homo.
What the hell are you doing here?
I wanna be a police officer.
What? I can't hear you-u?

[whispering]
I wanna be a police officer.
Don't unpack.

You know, Mahoney, I'd like to spend the next ten weeks breaking you into little pieces. But I won't. Because you're bad. You're bad for morale, Mahoney. Oh, you look like the sweet little boy from next door. But you don't fool me, oh no. You're the devil, and you're rotten to the core, and you're ruining my chance to train some people who might make pretty good cops!
Well, well, well... I told you not to try me, boy. Stand up.
[Mahoney stands up]
Now, I want you two squad leaders to take Mr. Mahoney here, and run him until he throws up.
Yes, sir.
Then, just after he throws up... run him some more.
Yes, sir.
You are going to learn, Mahoney, that nobody - *nobody* - screws with me.

[Lamenting the newly relaxed admission requirements for the Academy]
They all used to be the right color, the right height, the right weight. And they all had Johnsons, Lassard!
Johnsons?
You know...
[motions to his groin]
Oh, yes.
There were Johnsons as far as the eye can see.
Yes. And what a lovely sight it was.

[Seeing Tackleberry banging his head on the squad car hood]
What's wrong with this man?
There was gunplay, sir, and he missed it.
